text: It is believed that about 239 hostages remain in Hamas's hands.
A tentative deal to pause the conflict for at least five days in exchange for the release of dozens of women and children held hostage in Gaza is near agreement.
The report was vehemently denied by both Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and US officials.
Israel would also increase the amount of humanitarian aid allowed into Gaza, the official said.
The six-page agreement reportedly stipulates that around 50 hostages would begin to be released every 24 hours.
